author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Department of Management Studies of Erode Sengunthar Engineering College (ESEC) teamed up with Entrepreneurship Development Institute of India, Ahmedabad, to initiate an entrepreneurship awareness camp on Thursday.

Inaugurating the three-day camp, N. Sivanesan, president of Federation of Trade and Industry Associations of Erode district, encouraged students to start off their career as entrepreneurs by detailing the loans and subsidies available under government schemes.

Women, in particular, are entitled to special loans and subsidies offered by NABARD. Entrepreneurship could be spawned among students through creating opportunities for optimal utilisation of natural resources, he said.

Later in the day, P. Nandhakumar, Managing Director, Mayabazaar, Erode, elaborated on the skill sets that would make one a successful entrepreneur.

More than 150 students and teachers from various arts and science and engineering colleges are benefitting from the programme.

S.Sivananthan, Secretary, Erode Sengunthar Educational Trust, presided over inaugural session. R.Mohanraj, Correspondent, and L. Boopathi, College Principal, also addressed the gathering.
title: Entrepreneurship awareness camp begins
